HImageView

HImageView is a control unit intended to display images on the screen through the HTML <IMG> tag.  The HImageView class is a container to visualize images loaded via URL.  It supports scaling via two class methods, scaleToFit and scaleToOriginal.  If the image is unable to be loaded, a default blank image will be rendered.

Summary
HImageView
HImageView is a control unit intended to display images on the screen through the HTML <IMG> tag.
Instance variables
constructor
draw
Draws the rectangle and the markup of this object on the screen.
refresh
Redraws only the image, not the whole markup.
scaleToFit
Changes the size of the image element so that it fits in the rectangle of the view.
scaleToOriginal
Resizes the image element to its original dimesions.

Instance variables

type’[HImageView]’
valueURL pointing to the image that is currently shown.

constructor

constructor: function(_rect,
_parentClass,
_options)

Parameters

_rectAn HRect object that sets the position and dimensions of this control.
_parentClassThe parent view that this control is to be inserted in.
_options(optional) All other parameters.  See HComponentDefaults.

scaleToFit

scaleToFit: function()

Changes the size of the image element so that it fits in the rectangle of the view.

See also

scaleToOriginal

scaleToOriginal

scaleToOriginal: function()

Resizes the image element to its original dimesions.  If the image is larger than the rectangle of this view, clipping will occur.

See also

scaleToFit

Initializes the visual representation of the object, should call at least drawRect.
refresh: function()
This method should be extended in order to redraw only specific parts.
